item.title: Writing syslog Data to MySQL
item.description:
Writing syslog Data to MySQL

Written by Rainer Gerhards (2008-02-28) In this paper, I describe how to write syslog messages to aMySQL database. Having syslog messages in a database is often handy, especially when you intend to set up a front-end for viewing them. This paper describes an approach withrsyslogd, an alternative enhanced syslog daemon natively supporting MySQL.

item.title: syslog-protocol support in rsyslog
item.description:
syslog-protocol support in rsyslog

Rsyslog provides a trial implementation of the proposed syslog-protocol standard. The intention of this implementation is to find out what inside syslog-protocol is causing problems during implementation. As syslog-protocol is a standard under development, its support in rsyslog is highly volatile. It may change from release to release.

item.title: 7 Version Control Systems Reviewed - Smashing Magazine
item.description:
7 Version Control Systems Reviewed - Smashing Magazine

If you've ever collaborated with other people on a project, you know the frustration of constantly swapping files. Some do it by email, some through file upload services and some by other methods. It's a pain in the neck, and every designer and developer knows it.

item.title: rsyslog
item.description:
rsyslog

Written by Rainer Gerhards with some additions by Marc Schiffbauer (2008-02-28) *In this paper, I describe how to write* syslog *messages to a* MySQL *or* PostgreSQL *database.* Having syslog messages in a database is often handy, especially when you intend to set up a front-end for viewing them.

item.title: omsnmp: SNMP Trap Output Module - rsyslog 8.18.0 documentation
item.description:
omsnmp: SNMP Trap Output Module - rsyslog 8.18.0 documentation

This configuration parameter is used for SNMPv2 only. This is the OID which defines the trap-type, or notifcation-type rsyslog uses to send the trap. In order to decode this OID, you will need to have the ADISCON-MONITORWARE-MIB and ADISCON-MIB mibs installed on the receiver side.

item.title: Ubuntu Manpage: git-remote-bzr - Git remote support for Bazaar repositories
item.description:
Ubuntu Manpage: git-remote-bzr - Git remote support for Bazaar repositories

git-remote-bzr - Git remote support for Bazaar repositories

item.title: SharedRepositoryTutorial - wiki.bazaar.canonical.com
item.description:
SharedRepositoryTutorial - wiki.bazaar.canonical.com

One of the features in Bzr (0.8+) is shared repositories. This document will introduce the concept and explain their usage by showing an example. New users should read the introduction to bzr for a general overview of Bazaar. Before we start explaining what a shared repository is, we need to understand how branches work in Bazaar.

item.title: CSS z-index property
item.description:
CSS z-index property

Well organized and easy to understand Web bulding tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, PHP, and XML.
